Preoperative Diagnosis: Anterior mediastinal mass, possible lymphoma
Postoperative Diagnosis: Anterior mediastinal mass - consistent with Hodgkin lymphoma on frozen section

Procedure Performed: Thoracoscopy with excision of anterior mediastinal mass

Anesthesia: General endotracheal anesthesia with single-lung ventilation

Description:
The patient is a 50-year-old woman presenting with anterior mediastinal mass discovered on workup for chest tightness. CT and PET demonstrated 5.5cm heterogeneous anterior mediastinal mass with moderate FDG uptake. Core needle biopsy was non-diagnostic. Surgical excision for tissue diagnosis requested by oncology.

Patient [REDACTED] anesthesia. Left lateral decubitus position. Right chest entered via three ports as described. Thoracoscopy revealed 5.5cm mass in anterior mediastinum with lobulated appearance and involvement of thymic tissue. Mass dissected from surrounding structures including pericardium and superior vena cava with care. Complete excision achieved. Specimen extracted in bag.

Frozen section: Consistent with classical Hodgkin lymphoma.

Hemostasis confirmed. 24Fr Blake drain placed. Lung re-expanded. Incisions closed.

EBL: 100mL
Specimen: 6.0 x 5.2 x 4.0 cm mediastinal mass to permanent pathology
Complications: None
